title: How to Go Back Using the Command Prompt

steps.title: Open the Command prompt.
steps.content: Open the Command prompt . You can usually find it by typing “command” into the search bar and selecting it in the search results. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Type in the name of the file you want to see.
steps.content: Type in the name of the file you want to see. While in the command prompt menu, you can view any files on your computer in a text-only format by typing in the location (usually a disk) and the file name (including any extensions). [3] X Research source

steps.title: Type.
steps.content: Type . cd.. into the prompt. After you press Enter , this command tells the program to navigate back to the previous folder. [4] X Research source It’s important you type the two dots, since you won’t navigate anywhere if you simply type “cd” into the prompt.

steps.title: Type cd \ into the prompt to go back to the directory.
steps.content: Type cd \ into the prompt to go back to the directory. If you need to navigate from a location back to the main command prompt, this command takes you back immediately. [5] X Research source
